tech_news.title: This smart mirror was a menace at CES 2026 - The Verge
tech_news.description: The $899 Nuralogix Longevity Mirror takes a 30-second selfie and analyzes blood flow in your face to estimate how well you’re aging.

tech_news.title: SanDisk says goodbye to WD Blue and Black SSDs, hello to new “Optimus” drives - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: Optimus SSDs will continue with the same model numbers that the WD SSDs used.

tech_news.title: Samsung’s new phone looks straight out of science fiction. I got to try it - CNN
tech_news.description: With its new Galaxy Z TriFold, Samsung is betting it can wow consumers with an iPad-sized screen that folds up like a brochure to fit neatly in your pocket.

tech_news.title: YouTube Music lyrics sharing adding AI-generated backgrounds - 9to5Google
tech_news.description: YouTube Music introduced the ability to share lyrics last year and is now upgrading the background options with generative AI.

tech_news.title: Lego’s Smart Brick Gives the Iconic Analog Toy a New Digital Brain - WIRED
tech_news.description: The new sensor-packed Smart Play Brick will land this spring as part of a special Star Wars collection. The update adds interactive lights and sound to the Lego experience—including the Minifigs.

tech_news.title: Xbox to Bring Cloud Gaming to Select Hisense and V homeOS-powered Smart TVs - Xbox Wire
Hi-Fi Rush is finally getting a physical Xbox release - TrueAchievements
tech_news.description: It's good news for all the physical game collectors out there: Hi-Fi Rush is finally getting a physical release for Xbox Series X, which you can pre-order soon.

tech_news.title: Spectrum Front Row tips off January 9 on Apple Vision Pro - Apple
tech_news.description: Apple and Spectrum unveiled the schedule for The Lakers in Apple Immersive, a series of live basketball games in a revolutionary storytelling format available only on Apple Vision Pro.
